claim: Donald Trump was the most recent U.S. president not selected as Time's Person of the Year.

supporting.text: Donald Trump was last elected as U.S. president in 2016, and Time's Person of the Year selections since then have not included him.

attacks.text: Donald Trump was last elected as U.S. president in 2016, and Time's Person of the Year selections since then have not included him.
Time's Person of the Year is not strictly about election cycles but broader influence, so Trump's exclusion does not necessarily reflect his presidential status.
Time's selections are often politically or culturally motivated, not a direct measure of presidential relevance or impact.
Joe Biden, elected in 2020, was also not selected as Time's Person of the Year in 2020 or 2021, making the claim ambiguous.
Biden was not selected in 2020, but the claim specifies 'most recent U.S. president,' which still holds for Trump if Biden was not selected either.

supporting.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2020 was Joe Biden and Kamala Harris, who succeeded Trump as U.S. president and vice president.

attacks.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2020 was Joe Biden and Kamala Harris, who succeeded Trump as U.S. president and vice president.
Donald Trump was Time's Person of the Year in 2016, which means he was selected after his election but before his presidency began.
The claim specifies 'most recent U.S. president not selected,' and Trump was selected in 2016, so the claim is incorrect.
The 2016 selection was for Trump as President-elect, not as sitting president, which may not fully align with the claim's intent.

supporting.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2021 was Elon Musk, who is not a U.S. president, making Trump the most recent president not selected.

attacks.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2021 was Elon Musk, who is not a U.S. president, making Trump the most recent president not selected.
Joe Biden was selected as Time's Person of the Year in 2020, which is more recent than Trump's presidency, making Biden the most recent president not selected.
Time's Person of the Year selection is not strictly annual; some years have multiple or no selections, which could affect the recency comparison.
The claim specifies 'most recent U.S. president not selected,' and since Trump was not selected after his presidency, he remains the most recent under this definition.

supporting.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2022 was Volodymyr Zelensky, who is the president of Ukraine, not the U.S., confirming Trump's status as the most recent U.S. president not selected.

attacks.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2022 was Volodymyr Zelensky, who is the president of Ukraine, not the U.S., confirming Trump's status as the most recent U.S. president not selected.
The claim is misleading because it implies Trump was uniquely excluded, when in fact many U.S. presidents were not selected as Time's Person of the Year.
The claim is factually accurate in stating Trump was the most recent U.S. president not selected, regardless of how many others were also excluded.
Time's Person of the Year selection is subjective and not a meaningful metric for evaluating presidential legacy.
While subjective, Time's Person of Year is a widely recognized honor, making its exclusion notable for public figures like presidents.

supporting.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2023 was Taylor Swift, a musician and not a U.S. president, further supporting the claim about Trump.

attacks.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2023 was Taylor Swift, a musician and not a U.S. president, further supporting the claim about Trump.
The claim is about U.S. presidents, and Time's Person of the Year selection does not directly reflect presidential status or relevance.
Time's Person of the Year is often awarded based on cultural impact, not political significance, so its relevance to the claim is limited.
The claim could be misinterpreted as implying Time's selection is a measure of presidential merit, which it is not.
Time's criteria for Person of the Year are explicitly about influence, not merit or political achievement, clarifying the claim's scope.
